titleStmt.title: By the Queene. Forasmuch as the Queenes Maiestie our soueraigne Ladie is credibly enfourmed, that the infection of the plague is at this present in sundry places in and about the citie of Westminster ...
Proclamations. 1576-09-29
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)

publicationStmt.publisher: By Richarde Iugge [i.e. B. Norton and J. Bill], printer to the Queenes Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: Actual printers' names and publication date from STC.
A proclamation adjourning Michaelmas term because of plague.
Last complete line of text ends: "made,"--STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
